item.title: Alexa add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I don't know anything with certainty, but seeing the stars makes me dream." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "When it is dark enough, you can see the stars." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Peace cannot be achieved through violence, it can only be attained through understanding." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "One of the illusions of life is that the present hour is not the critical, decisive hour. Write it on your hear that every day is the best day of the year." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Thus inevitably does the universe wear our color, and every object fall successively into the subject itself. The subject exists, the subject enlarges; all things sooner or later fall into place. As I am, so I see; use what language we will, we can never say anything but what we are." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "All my best thoughts were stolen by the ancients." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us, or we find it not." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The only true gift is a portion of thyself." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The end of the human race will be that it will eventually die of civilization." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Alexa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "In sorrow we must go, but not in despair. Behold! we are not bound for ever to the circles of the world, and beyond them is more than memory." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Alexa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Alexa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places; but still there is much that is fair, and though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Alexa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Alexa add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson
